datasource: Lamberti, Marcello. 1993. Die Shinassha-Sprache. Materialen zum Boro. Heidelberg: Carl Winter Universitätsverlag.[MLA93]

transcription.Vowels: i e a o u; ii ee aa oo uu

dataNotes.1: The verbs listed in the lexeme section all have slight inflectional idiosyncracies in the affirmative. In the negative the inflect regularly on the basis of a special negative stem .

geodemoTXT: Varieties and subdialects of the Omotic language Shinassha are spoken in Ethiopia, ZZBenishangul-Gumuz region: Metekel zone, near Blue Nile riverZZ; approx 37,500 speakers.

termclusters.label: shn-VerbAffirmative-am-
termclusters.note: ML93Ap201 :: Interrogative forms are made by substituting the interrogative pronominal endings for the non-interrogative in the (otherwise fully formed) non-iterrogative form. Special mention need be made only for the Jussive,aff and neg,and the neg aorHab

termclusters.label: shn-VerbAffirmativeConjunctive-am-Conj1
termclusters.note: ML93Ap157 :: Note prefixation of pronominal forms

termclusters.label: shn-VerbAffirmativePresent-Copula-
termclusters.note: ML93Ap203 :: Has only present positive and negative. Past tenses come from ja-,future/jussive from woott-. In some cases adjectives can be directly conjugated like verbs. Cf. also paradigm for fa- éxist

termclusters.label: shn-VerbConjunctive-fa-
termclusters.note: ML93Ap180 ::  fa- 'exist' is an extremely defective verb and seems to have only two tenses; homophonous stem disambiguated by prefixing of pronominal form

termclusters.label: shn-VerbIndicativePresent-fa-
termclusters.note: ML93Ap180 :: fa- 'exist'is an extremely defective verb and seems to have only two tenses
